comment: The lecture slides are taken directly from the textbook, with minimal additional explanation or alternative approaches to help deepen understanding. The instructor can come across as dismissive or unapproachable when questions are asked. Overall, support is limited, and it would be helpful if more study resources were made available.
Great professor! She wants her student to do well, she is fair, presents the material in a manner that is enjoyable and engages her students
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Her lectures were always very boring and consisted of marking important slides. Easy class to pass if you pay any amount of attention to the room. Not many grades though, the syllabus says there is only a midterm, and a final, but if you just go to class, it's really hard to fail.

Do not take this Professor I have finished the class and she hasn't graded an assignment since early September and it is now December. I have received a 90 and 80 on two assignments with no feedback essentially just "Good job" with no answer or markups to what I did incorrectly. I emailed her for her to say I missed some stuff that wasn't in rubric

She's incredibly nice, however I cannot recommend this professor. Lectures are just reading off of a pre-made textbook powerpoint with little explanation. Tests are also heavy and very effort-some with lack of multiple choice. I got a high grade but not without a whole lot of personal research.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Tests are way harder than they need to be, only a couple multiple choice questions mainly open ended response questions some fill in the blanks without a word bank. If you do not have a perfect memory then you will def struggle. Tests are in person too.

Professor Cantor's teaching style is not for hands-on learners. Beware, kinesthetic and visual learners may not do as well because she talks way too much and doesn't give sufficient practice. Gives very little information about what is truly on quizzes. Study guides are a list of vocabulary words that are not discussed thoroughly. No thanks.
